## Introduction

Does a school environment and location influence student behaviors or performance in school? 


```{r}
library(tidyverse)

chicago <- 
  read.csv("chicago_public_schools.csv")

head(chicago) |> 
  select(School.ID, ZIP.Code, Safety.Icon, Rate.of.Misconducts..per.100.students., Safety.Score, CPS.Performance.Policy.Level, Community.Area.Name, Police.District) |> 
  knitr::kable(col.names = c("School ID", "School Zip Code", "Safety Icon", "Rate of Misconduct Per 100 Students", "Safety Score (1-99)", "CPS Performance Policy Level (1-5)", "Community Area Name", "Police District"))

```
## Data 

```{r}
library(tidyverse)
library(ggplot2)

chicago |> 
  select(Rate.of.Misconducts..per.100.students. , Safety.Score) |> 
  drop_na(Safety.Score, Rate.of.Misconducts..per.100.students.) |>
  ggplot(mapping = aes( x = Safety.Score , y = Rate.of.Misconducts..per.100.students.)) + 
  geom_point(alpha = 0.5) + 
  labs(x = "Safety Score (1-99)", y = "Rate of Misconduct Per 100 Students", title = "School Safety Score v. School Misconduct Rate", subtitle = " Across 513 Chicago Public Schools in the 2011-2012 School Year") + 
  geom_smooth(method = "lm") +
  ylim(0, 100) 
```

## Results

```{r}
library(broom)
library(infer)
library(modelsummary)
model1 <-
  lm(Rate.of.Misconducts..per.100.students. ~ Safety.Score, data = chicago) 

modelsummary(list(model1), gof_omit = 'DF|Deviance|R2|AIC|BIC|Log.Lik|RMSE|Num.Obs', statistic = NULL)

```
